title: Pulp Fiction
description: Crime film directed by Quentin Tarantino, intertwining multiple storylines in Los Angeles with a lot of talking and even more bullets.

title: Reservoir Dogs
description: Tarantino debut about a botched diamond heist, sharp suits, sharp dialogue and very unsafe ear conditions.

title: The Hateful Eight
description: Western mystery where eight strangers hide from a blizzard and slowly prove that cabin sharing is a terrible idea.

title: The Godfather
description: Classic crime saga about the Corleone family, business offers you really cannot refuse and a suspicious amount of oranges.

title: The Green Mile
description: Prison drama with miracles, a very large inmate, a very small mouse and emotions that should come with a tissue warning.

title: The Shawshank Redemption
description: Hope, friendship and a lot of rock hammer patience in one of the most beloved prison escape stories ever filmed.

title: Forrest Gump
description: Life is like a box of chocolates and Forrest somehow runs through half of American history in one go.

title: Requiem for a Dream
description: Stylish but brutal descent into addiction that will convince you to treat all life choices with a bit more respect.

title: The Matrix
description: Hacker discovers reality is fake, physics is optional and sunglasses are mandatory even at night.

title: The Silence of the Lambs
description: A young FBI trainee, a brilliant cannibal and a reminder to never accept dinner invitations from certain doctors.

title: Avatar
description: Marine gets a very blue new body, discovers nature, flying dragons and that corporations are not great neighbors.

title: Gladiator
description: Roman general becomes a gladiator, wins crowds, swings swords and politely asks if everyone is entertained.
screenwriter: David Franzoni; John Logan; William Nicholson

title: Shrek
description: A grumpy ogre, a talkative donkey and a princess prove that fairy tales can also smell like swamp.
screenwriter: Ted Elliott; Terry Rossio; Joe Stillman; Roger S.H. Schulman

title: Titanic
description: Epic romance on an unsinkable ship that famously did not read the marketing materials carefully enough.

title: Shutter Island
description: US marshal investigates a missing patient on an isolated island where nothing is quite what it seems.

title: Inglourious Basterds
description: Alternate WWII where cinema, revenge and Tarantino dialogue team up against Nazis in very explosive ways.

title: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest
description: Charismatic troublemaker shakes up a mental institution and proves that rebellion can be very expensive.
screenwriter: Bo Goldman; Lawrence Hauben; Ken Kesey

title: The Butterfly Effect
description: Man revisits his past, changes tiny details and learns that debugging timelines is harder than debugging code.

title: Gran Torino
description: Grumpy veteran, noisy neighbors and one classic car in a story that slowly swaps anger for understanding.

title: The Dark Knight
description: Batman faces the Joker, moral chaos and serious voice filter issues in one of the most praised superhero films.
screenwriter: Jonathan Nolan; Christopher Nolan; David S. Goyer

title: Fight Club
description: An insomniac office worker forms an underground fight club that evolves into something much more destructive.

title: Inception
description: A thief who steals corporate secrets through dream-sharing technology is given the inverse task of planting an idea.

title: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring
description: A meek Hobbit and eight companions set out on a journey to destroy the One Ring and save Middle-earth.
screenwriter: Fran Walsh; Philippa Boyens; Peter Jackson; J.R.R. Tolkien

title: Star Wars: Episode V - The Empire Strikes Back
description: After the Rebels are brutally overpowered by the Empire, Luke Skywalker begins Jedi training with Yoda.
screenwriter: Leigh Brackett; Lawrence Kasdan; George Lucas

title: Interstellar
description: A team of explorers travel through a wormhole in space in an attempt to ensure humanity's survival.

title: Parasite
description: Greed and class discrimination threaten the newly formed symbiotic relationship between the wealthy Park family and the destitute Kim clan.

title: The Wolf of Wall Street
description: Based on the true story of Jordan Belfort, from his rise to a wealthy stock-broker to his fall involving crime and corruption.

title: Goodfellas
description: The story of Henry Hill and his life in the mob, covering his relationship with his wife Karen and his mob partners.

title: Se7en
description: Two detectives, a rookie and a veteran, hunt a serial killer who uses the seven deadly sins as his motives.

title: The Prestige
description: After a tragic accident, two stage magicians engage in a battle to create the ultimate illusion while sacrificing everything they have.
screenwriter: Jonathan Nolan; Christopher Nolan; Christopher Priest

title: Jurassic Park
description: A pragmatic paleontologist visiting an almost complete theme park is tasked with protecting a couple of kids after a power failure causes the park's cloned dinosaurs to run loose.

title: Back to the Future
description: Marty McFly, a 17-year-old high school student, is accidentally sent thirty years into the past in a time-traveling DeLorean invented by his close friend, the eccentric scientist Doc Brown.

title: The Lion King
description: Lion prince Simba and his father are targeted by his bitter uncle, who wants to ascend the throne himself.
screenwriter: Irene Mecchi; Jonathan Roberts; Linda Woolverton

title: Casablanca
description: A cynical expatriate American cafe owner struggles to decide whether or not to help his former lover and her fugitive husband escape the Nazis in French Morocco.
screenwriter: Julius J. Epstein; Philip G. Epstein; Howard Koch

title: Psycho
description: A Phoenix secretary embezzles $40,000 from her employer's client, goes on the run, and checks into a remote motel run by a young man under the domination of his mother.

title: La La Land
description: While navigating their careers in Los Angeles, a pianist and an actress fall in love while attempting to reconcile their aspirations for the future.

title: The Terminator
description: A human soldier is sent from 2029 to 1984 to stop an almost indestructible cyborg killing machine, sent from the same year, which has been programmed to execute a young woman whose unborn son is the key to humanity's future salvation.

title: Star Wars: Episode III - Revenge of the Sith
description: The dark side clouds everything as Anakin Skywalker succumbs to his fears and hatred, completing his transformation into Darth Vader.

title: Transformers
description: A teenager discovers his car is actually an alien robot, sparking an ancient war between Autobots and Decepticons on Earth.
screenwriter: Roberto Orci; Alex Kurtzman; John Rogers

title: The Avengers
description: Earth's mightiest heroes must come together to stop Loki and his alien army from enslaving humanity.

title: The Social Network
description: The story of how Facebook was created, filled with brilliant coding, betrayal, lawsuits, and changing how the world connects.

title: Dunkirk
description: Allied soldiers from Belgium, Britain, and France are surrounded by the German army during WWII and must be evacuated in a desperate battle for survival.

title: Toy Story
description: A cowboy doll is profoundly threatened and jealous when a new spaceman action figure supplants him as top toy in a boy's bedroom.
screenwriter: John Lasseter; Pete Docter; Andrew Stanton; Joe Ranft

title: The Departed
description: An undercover cop and a mole in the police attempt to identify each other while infiltrating an Irish gang in South Boston.
screenwriter: William Monahan; Alan Mak; Felix Chong

title: Whiplash
description: A promising young drummer enrolls at a cutthroat music conservatory where his dreams of greatness are mentored by an instructor who will stop at nothing to realize a student's potential.

title: Get Out
description: A young African-American visits his white girlfriend's parents for the weekend, where his simmering uneasiness about their reception of him eventually reaches a boiling point.

title: Mad Max: Fury Road
description: In a post-apocalyptic wasteland, a woman rebels against a tyrannical ruler in search of her homeland with the aid of a group of female prisoners, a psychotic worshiper, and a drifter named Max.
screenwriter: George Miller; Brendan McCarthy; Nick Lathouris

title: Blade Runner 2049
description: Young Blade Runner K's discovery of a long-buried secret leads him to track down former Blade Runner Rick Deckard, who's been missing for thirty years.
screenwriter: Hampton Fancher; Michael Green; Philip K. Dick

title: Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse
description: Teen Miles Morales becomes the Spider-Man of his universe and must join with five spider-powered individuals from other dimensions to stop a threat to all reality.
director: Bob Persichetti; Peter Ramsey; Rodney Rothman

title: The Grand Budapest Hotel
description: A writer encounters the owner of an aging high-class hotel, who tells him of his early years serving as a lobby boy in the hotel's glorious years under an exceptional concierge.

title: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
description: An orphaned boy enrolls in a school of wizardry, where he learns the truth about himself, his family and the terrible evil that haunts the magical world.

title: Joker
description: In Gotham City, mentally troubled comedian Arthur Fleck is disregarded and mistreated by society. He then embarks on a downward spiral of revolution and bloody crime.

title: The Big Lebowski
description: Jeff "The Dude" Lebowski, mistaken for a millionaire of the same name, seeks restitution for his ruined rug and enlists his bowling buddies to help get it.

title: Blade Runner
description: A blade runner must pursue and terminate four replicants who stole a ship in space and have returned to Earth to find their creator.
screenwriter: Hampton Fancher; David Peoples; Philip K. Dick

title: Kill Bill: Vol. 1
description: After awakening from a four-year coma, a former assassin wreaks vengeance on the team of assassins who betrayed her.

title: 12 Angry Men
description: A jury holdout attempts to prevent a miscarriage of justice by forcing his colleagues to reconsider the evidence.

title: The Thing
description: A research team in Antarctica is hunted by a shape-shifting alien that assumes the appearance of its victims.
screenwriter: Bill Lancaster; John W. Campbell Jr.

title: Mission: Impossible - Fallout
description: Ethan Hunt and his IMF team, along with some familiar allies, race against time after a mission gone wrong.
